column4: anyone know a good way to stream music on ubuntu, something like shoutcast
use VLC
it's a media player with great streaming capabilities
ohh, then maybe you want to check up on shoutcast for Linux
depends on your needs
the MP3 collection would do best on ReiserFS, IMO
my suggestion is a tftp server
as long as you specify a local IP, _all_ connections will go through locally
commandline
there's a man page on almost everything, tftpd included
tftp tends to me nice and hassle free for me
something trivial like that is not available in Linux in GUI
no, it's not, neither is it in Windows
don't make claims that you can't back up, becasue Winrar can do it
if it has a CRC error, are you sure?
........... do you know what a RAR index is?
please use propper grammer ("there") before I consider being outsmarted
an archive consists of an index, so that the archive can specify to the decompressor where the bits of compressed data as, and what that data refers to
It's CRC Failed Error
a CRC check checks against the signature of the archive to see whether the archive is valid or not
CAn i turn it off?
Is their a program that doesn't have a CRC checker
it definitely is
